question_text:
Question 19
The ratio of the activation energy of a chemical reaction to the universal gas constant is 1000 K. The 
temperature-dependence of the reaction rate constant follows the collision theory. The ratio of the rate 
constant at 600 K to that at 400 K is 
 
[Chemical reaction Engineering, 1 Marks]
 
 
(A) 2.818 
(B) 4.323
(C) 1.502 
(D) 1.000
